document.title: PB1599-Carpenter Ants - Those Big Ants in Your Kitchen and Bathroom

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: Ever wondered about those big, black ants in your house? You know, the ants you spray every time you see them in the kitchen and bathroom â€” but they keep coming back. Or, maybe it took the occurrence of a mating flight of the winged forms (usually in the spring or summer) to alert you to their presence, since the worker ants (no wings) are most active at dusk or in the evening. This publication will help you deal with this challenging pest problem.
document.publication-title: Insects, Pests, Plant Diseases and Weeds
